title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: A little-known flu virus is sickening cattle around the world. Are humans next?
items.description: Features of recently identified influenza D point to possible pandemic threat

items.title: Unorthodox ‘universal vaccine’ offers broad protection in mice
items.description: Immune-stimulating cocktail could shield against diverse bacterial and viral infections

items.title: Pollution plume from falling rocket debris tracked in real time
items.description: New analysis sheds light on space junk’s small, growing effects on upper atmosphere

items.title: Scientists decry Trump’s rush to loosen radiation exposure standards
items.description: White House push to boost nuclear power could lead to more cancer cases, some researchers say

items.title: Musical chairs leadership shake-up planned for science agencies
items.description: CDC acting Director Jim O’Neill to be nominated to lead NSF while NIH Director Jay Bhattacharya does double duty at CDC

items.title: Highly destructive mussel has started to invade the Amazon
items.description: After ravaging waterways across South America, the fast-spreading species threatens a biodiversity stronghold

items.title: Squashed skulls found in China belong to first known East Asians
items.description: Revised dating of enigmatic Yunxian skulls pushes their age back 800,000 years, challenges idea of Denisovan ancestry

items.title: This glass wafer could back up your phone—and last 10,000 years
items.description: Laser-written patterns on glass could store data for millennia at a time

items.title: How do busy bees avoid overheating from flying?
items.description: New measurements could help predict pollinators’ ability to withstand climate change

items.title: If AI discovers a drug, who gets the money?
items.description: Two intellectual property lawyers on why questions of AI inventorship and profit remain wide open
